intro: Lagenophora adenosa, commonly known as the silverleaf daisies, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features silver-gray foliage with a dense covering of fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are typically yellow or white, arranged in daisy-like clusters. Lagenophora adenosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
